intro: Hieraciodes djimilensis, commonly known as the Djimilensis Hieraciodes, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to its harsh habitat. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
